name: Evolutionary Escalation
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put three +1/+1 counters on target creature you control and three +1/+1 counters on target creature an opponent controls.

editions.flavor: Survival is a constant competition from which both sides can benefit.

name: Evolutionary Leap
text: {G}, Sacrifice a creature: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

editions.flavor: The essence of nature is change.
The essence of nature is change.

name: Evolution Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

name: Evolution Vat
text: {3}, {T}: Tap target creature and put a +1/+1 counter on it. Until end of turn, that creature gains "{2}{G}{U}: Double the number of +1/+1 counters on this creature."

editions.flavor: The vats are self-contained worlds, bubbling and churning with unnatural speed, boiling down eons of change into moments.

name: Evolving Wilds
text: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor: Every world is an organism, able to grow new lands. Some just do it faster than others.

"Don't you ever wonder what lies beyond the Hekma? Beyond the reach of the gods? Beyond the horns on the horizon?"
—Samut, initiate of Tah crop

name: Exalted Angel
text:
Flying
Whenever Exalted Angel deals damage, you gain that much life.
Morph {2}{W}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.flavor:
"She is a theme of honor and reknown, ...Whose present courage may beat down our foes."
—William Shakespeare, Troilus and Cressida

name: Exalted Dragon
text:
Flying
Exalted Dragon can't attack unless you sacrifice a land. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)

editions.flavor: If dragons excel at anything more than vanity, it is greed.
If dragons excel at anything more than vanity, it is greed.

name: Exava, Rakdos Blood Witch
text:
First strike, haste
Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Each other creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has haste.

name: Excavation
text: {1}, Sacrifice a land: Draw a card. Any player may activate this ability.

editions.flavor:
"There are secrets out there begging to be rediscovered. We just need to look in the right places."
—Teferi, planeswalker

name: Excavator
text: {T}, Sacrifice a basic land: Target creature gains landwalk of each of the land types of the sacrificed land until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a land of any of those types.)

name: Excise
text: Exile target attacking creature unless its controller pays {X}.

editions.flavor:
"Creation is no great feat. Anything you make, I can unmake in a heartbeat."
—Alexi, zephyr mage

name: Exclude
text:
Counter target creature spell.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"I don't have time for you right now."
—Teferi

"I don't have time for you right now."
—Teferi

name: Exclusion Ritual
text:
Imprint — When Exclusion Ritual enters the battlefield, exile target nonland permanent.
Players can't cast spells with the same name as the exiled card.

editions.flavor:
"Your desires have become our discretion."
—Izathel, priest of the Annex

name: Excommunicate
text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

editions.flavor:
"Our law prohibits capital punishment. We believe even the gravest offenders have the chance to redeem themselves."
—Torian Sha, soul warden

"Our law prohibits capital punishment. We believe even the gravest offenders have the chance to redeem themselves."
—Torian Sha, soul warden
Rebels and other malcontents forced into the ritual awake lost in Topa's vast savannahs. Those who find their way back return humble and repentant.

name: Excoriate
text: Exile target tapped creature.

editions.flavor: The demon had flown past the reach of Erebos's whip but not the point of the sun god's spear.

name: Excruciator
text: Damage that would be dealt by Excruciator can't be prevented.

editions.flavor:
"Though used as a piercing weapon, the tusk is more akin to a stinger, spreading pain instantly throughout the body of its victim. This specimen deserves further study."
—Simic research notes

name: Execute
text:
Destroy target white creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Any fool who would die for honor is better off dead."
—Cabal Patriarch

"Any fool who would die for honor is better off dead."
—Cabal Patriarch

"Any fool who would die for honor is better off dead."
—Cabal Patriarch

name: Executioner's Capsule
text: {1}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice Executioner's Capsule: Destroy target nonblack creature.

editions.flavor: There is always a moment of trepidation before opening a message capsule, for fear of the judgment that might be contained within.
There is always a moment of trepidation before opening a message capsule, for fear of the judgment that might be contained within.
There is always a moment of trepidation before opening a message capsule, for fear of the judgment that might be contained within.

name: Executioner's Hood
text:
Equipped creature has intimidate. (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Executioner's Swing
text: Target creature that dealt damage this turn gets -5/-5 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "The contract specified an appendage for a missed payment. Read the fine print: the head is an appendage."

name: Exemplar of Strength
text:
When Exemplar of Strength enters the battlefield, put three -1/-1 counters on target creature you control.
Whenever Exemplar of Strength attacks, remove a -1/-1 counter from it. If you do, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: "No one is born worthy."

name: Exert Influence
text: Converge — Gain control of target creature if its power is less than or equal to the number of colors of mana spent to cast Exert Influence.

editions.flavor: "I can't control its mind—I'm not even sure it has one. But I can dominate its will."
"I can't control its mind—I'm not even sure it has one. But I can dominate its will."

name: Exhaustion
text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.

editions.flavor: The mage felt as though he'd been in the stasis suit for days. Upon his return, he found it was months.
Tired doesn't even begin to cover it.
Starving and worn, Cao Cao escaped from the battle of Red Cliffs with only 27 of his original 800,000 men.

name: Exhume
text: Each player puts a creature card from his or her graveyard onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"Death—an outmoded concept. We sleep, and we change."
—Sitrik, birth priest

"Death—an outmoded concept. We sleep, and we change."
—Sitrik, birth priest

"Death—an outmoded concept. We sleep, and we change."
—Sitrik, birth priest

name: Exhumer Thrull
text:
Haunt (When this creature dies, exile it haunting target creature.)
When Exhumer Thrull enters the battlefield or the creature it haunts dies, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Exile
text: Exile target nonwhite attacking creature. You gain life equal to its toughness.

name: Exiled Boggart
text: When Exiled Boggart dies, discard a card.

editions.flavor: Among the boggarts, there is only one real rule: all new treasures and experiences must be shared. Those who hoard their gifts commit the one truly unforgivable sin.

name: Exiled Doomsayer
text: All morph costs cost {2} more. (This doesn't affect the cost to cast creature spells face down.)

editions.flavor: He's desperate to hold back the future because he has seen it.

name: Exile into Darkness
text:
Target player sacrifices a creature with converted mana cost 3 or less.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have more cards in hand than each opponent, you may return Exile into Darkness from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Exorcist
text: {1}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black creature.

editions.flavor: Though they often bore little greater charm than the demons they battled, exorcists were always welcome in Scarwood.
Though they often bore little greater charm than the demons they battled, exorcists were always welcome in Scarwood.

name: Exoskeletal Armor
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +X/+X, where X is the number of creature cards in all graveyards.

editions.flavor:
"We use only what we need—but in times of strife, our need becomes great."
—Centaur warrior

name: Exotic Curse
text:
Enchant creature
Domain — Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 for each basic land type among lands you control.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
editions.flavor:
Fouler than a necromancer's kiss.
—Jamuraan expression

Fouler than a necromancer's kiss.
—Jamuraan expression

name: Exotic Disease
text: Domain — Target player loses X life and you gain X life, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.

editions.flavor:
"Do not fear death. I shall release you from the eternal bonds and bring you glory."
—Lord Dralnu

name: Exotic Orchard
text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.

editions.flavor:
"It was a strange morning. When we awoke, we found our trees transformed. We didn't know whether to water them or polish them."
—Pulan, Bant orchardist

"It was a strange morning. When we awoke, we found our trees transformed. We didn't know whether to water them or polish them."
—Pulan, Bant orchardist

—Pulan, Bant orchardist

"It was a strange morning. When we awoke, we found our trees transformed. We didn't know whether to water them or polish them."
—Pulan, Bant orchardist

name: Expedite
text:
Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: "I run, and thunder follows."
The unofficial motto of every expedition house is "ready for anything," a phrase whose significance has been amplified since the emergence of the Eldrazi.

name: Expedition Map
text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Expedition Map: Search your library for a land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"I use maps to find out where explorers have already been. Then I go the other way."
—Javad Nasrin, Ondu relic hunter

"I use maps to find out where explorers have already been. Then I go the other way."
—Javad Nasrin, Ondu relic hunter

name: Expedition Raptor
text:
Flying
When Expedition Raptor enters the battlefield, support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two other target creatures.)

name: Expendable Troops
text: {T}, Sacrifice Expendable Troops: Expendable Troops deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

editions.flavor: No doubt in their minds, no fear in their hearts.

name: Experimental Aviator
text:
Flying
When Experimental Aviator enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature tokens with flying.

editions.flavor: "The little thopters seemed lonely up here, so I thought I'd join them."

name: Experiment Kraj
text:
Experiment Kraj has all activated abilities of each other creature with a +1/+1 counter on it.
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

editions.flavor:
"Of course it will grow beyond control—it was designed to choose its own evolution."
—Momir Vig

name: Experiment One
text:
Evolve (Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if that creature has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
Remove two +1/+1 counters from Experiment One: Regenerate Experiment One.

name: Exploding Borders
text: Domain — Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library. Exploding Borders deals X damage to target player, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.

editions.flavor: Reuniting a world is not a gentle process.

name: Exploration
text: You may play an additional land on each of your turns.

editions.flavor: The first explorers found Argoth a storehouse of natural wealth—towering forests grown over rich veins of ore.

"Only when we journey into the unknown can we find the impossible."
—Cyrul the Wanderer

name: Explore
text:
You may play an additional land this turn.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: An explorer's reward is a view of tomorrow's possibilities.

"I will never run out of new oceans to explore or new sea-dwellers to embrace as my own."
—Kiora
An explorer's reward is a view of tomorrow's possibilities.

name: Explorer's Scope
text:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, look at the top card of your library. If it's a land card, you may put it onto the battlefield tapped.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Explosive Apparatus
text: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice Explosive Apparatus: Explosive Apparatus deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor:
"Souls are volatile things. When compressed and loaded into a handheld device, their destructive potential is quite impressive."
—Dierk, geistmage

name: Explosive Growth
text:
Kicker {5} (You may pay an additional {5} as you cast this spell.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If Explosive Growth was kicked, that creature gets +5/+5 until end of turn instead.

name: Explosive Impact
text: Explosive Impact deals 5 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor:
"Such boorish noise is what passes for subtlety among the Boros."
—Vraska

name: Explosive Revelation
text: Choose target creature or player. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonland card. Explosive Revelation deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to that creature or player. Put the nonland card into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Explosive Vegetation
text: Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Torching Krosa would be pointless. It grows faster than it burns.
Torching Krosa would be pointless. It grows faster than it burns.
Torching Krosa would be pointless. It grows faster than it burns.
Despite the flames and devastation of the dragons, Tarkir continued to thrive.
Torching Krosa would be pointless. It grows faster than it burns.
Torching Krosa would be pointless. It grows faster than it burns.

name: Expose Evil
text:
Tap up to two target creatures.
Investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")

editions.flavor:
"Only the pure stand tall in the light."
—Sigarda

name: Expropriate
text: Council's dilemma — Starting with you, each player votes for time or money. For each time vote, take an extra turn after this one. For each money vote, choose a permanent owned by the voter and gain control of it. Exile Expropriate.

editions.flavor: Few things are more valuable than time or money—and Leovold has plenty of both.

name: Expunge
text:
Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Exquisite Archangel
text:
Flying
If you would lose the game, instead exile Exquisite Archangel and your life total becomes equal to your starting life total.

editions.flavor: A living invention born of a grand design.

name: Exquisite Blood
text: Whenever an opponent loses life, you gain that much life.

editions.flavor: Even as humans regained the upper hand, some still willingly traded their lives for a chance at immortality.

name: Exquisite Firecraft
text:
Exquisite Firecraft deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
Spell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, Exquisite Firecraft can't be countered by spells or abilities.

editions.flavor: Chandra's gift set her apart and others aflame.
Chandra's gift set her apart and others aflame.

name: Exsanguinate
text: Each opponent loses X life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

editions.flavor: Vampires don't consider patience a virtue nor gluttony a sin.

name: Extinction
text: Destroy all creatures of the creature type of your choice.

editions.flavor:
"I once had an entire race killed just to listen to the rattling of their dried bones as I waded through them."
—Volrath

name: Extinguish
text: Counter target sorcery spell.

name: Extinguish All Hope
text: Destroy all nonenchantment creatures.

editions.flavor: Phenax offers the hope of life, while Pharika grants the solace of death. Between them stands Erebos, who promises nothing but eternity.

name: Extirpate
text:
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
Choose target card in a graveyard other than a basic land card. Search its owner's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that card and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Extortion
text: Look at target player's hand and choose up to two cards from it. That player discards those cards.

editions.flavor: The enforcers make no effort to distinguish gold from flesh.

name: Extra Arms
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor:
"Perhaps extra heads would have served them better."
—Foothill guide

name: Extract
text: Search target player's library for a card and exile it. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

editions.flavor: To say Nixar had a splitting headache would be a bit of an understatement.

name: Extract from Darkness
text: Each player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. Then put a creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.

editions.flavor: If you want to wreak havoc above, sometimes it's best to look below.
If you want to wreak havoc above, sometimes it's best to look below.

name: Extractor Demon
text:
Flying
Whenever another creature leaves the battlefield, you may have target player put the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Unearth {2}{B} ({2}{B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

name: Extraplanar Lens
text:
Imprint — When Extraplanar Lens enters the battlefield, you may exile target land you control.
Whenever a land with the same name as the exiled card is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.

name: Extravagant Spirit
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Extravagant Spirit unless you pay {1} for each card in your hand.

editions.flavor: The fewer your possessions, the fewer your worries.

name: Extricator of Flesh
text:
Eldrazi you control have vigilance.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice a non-Eldrazi creature: Create a 3/2 colorless Eldrazi Horror creature token.

editions.flavor: After the end, a new beginning.

name: Extricator of Sin
text:
When Extricator of Sin enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice another permanent. If you do, create a 3/2 colorless Eldrazi Horror creature token.
Delirium — At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, transform Extricator of Sin.

name: Extruder
text:
Echo {4} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
Sacrifice an artifact: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

editions.flavor: As the invasion drew closer, Urza's means began to resemble Phyrexia's end.

name: Exuberant Firestoker
text:
At the beginning of your end step, if you control a creature with power 5 or greater, you may have Exuberant Firestoker deal 2 damage to target player.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: The artistry of Etlan's firedancers is more spectacular when behemoths join in.

name: Exultant Cultist
text: When Exultant Cultist dies, draw a card.

editions.flavor: Amid the gibbering chorus that rose from the drownyard temple, Jace recognized a single word: "Emrakul."

name: Eyeblight Assassin
text: When Eyeblight Assassin enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Boggart blood disgusts me almost as much as the foul creatures themselves."

name: Eyeblight Massacre
text: Non-Elf creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "I've already seen so much evil, so much darkness. Why do you insist on adding more?"—Nissa Revane, to Dwynen

name: Eyeblight's Ending
text: Destroy target non-Elf creature.

editions.flavor:
"Those without beauty are Lorwyn's greatest tumor. The winnowers have an unpleasant duty, but a necessary one."
—Eidren, perfect of Lys Alana

"Those without beauty are Lorwyn's greatest tumor. The winnowers have an unpleasant duty, but a necessary one."
—Eidren, perfect of Lys Alana

"Those without beauty are Lorwyn's greatest tumor. The winnowers have an unpleasant duty, but a necessary one."
—Eidren, perfect of Lys Alana

name: Eye for an Eye
text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, instead that source deals that much damage to you and Eye for an Eye deals that much damage to that source's controller.

name: Eye Gouge
text: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. If it's a Cyclops, destroy it.

editions.flavor: One chance. One throw. One perfect hit.

name: Eyeless Watcher
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
When Eyeless Watcher enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 colorless Eldrazi Scion creature tokens. They have "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C} to your mana pool."

editions.flavor: Every Eldrazi in Ulamog's lineage is an extension of the titan's will.

name: Eye of Doom
text:
When Eye of Doom enters the battlefield, each player chooses a nonland permanent and puts a doom counter on it.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Eye of Doom: Destroy each permanent with a doom counter on it.

name: Eye of Nowhere
text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"Once we prayed to the kaijin for safe voyage. Now we only pray that we can escape their gaze."
—Hayato, master sailor

name: Eye of Ramos
text:
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
Sacrifice Eye of Ramos: Add {U} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Ramos wept, and there were seas.

name: Eye of Singularity
text:
When Eye of Singularity enters the battlefield, destroy each permanent with the same name as another permanent, except for basic lands. They can't be regenerated.
Whenever a permanent other than a basic land enters the battlefield, destroy all other permanents with that name. They can't be regenerated.

name: Eye of the Storm
text: Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery card, exile it. Then that player copies each instant or sorcery card exiled with Eye of the Storm. For each copy, the player may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

name: Eye of Ugin
text:
Colorless Eldrazi spells you cast cost {2} less to cast.
{7}, {T}: Search your library for a colorless creature card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: An eye closes. A race awakens.
An eye closes. A race awakens.

name: Eye of Yawgmoth
text: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Reveal a number of cards from the top of your library equal to the sacrificed creature's power. Put one into your hand and exile the rest.

name: Eyes in the Skies
text: Create a 1/1 white Bird creature token with flying, then populate. (Create a token that's a copy of a creature token you control.)

editions.flavor:
"What root and branch cannot reach, our winged friends will attend to."
—Zunak, Selesnya strategist

"What root and branch cannot reach, our winged friends will attend to."
—Zunak, Selesnya strategist

name: Eyes of the Watcher
text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

name: Eyes of the Wisent
text: Whenever an opponent casts a blue spell during your turn, you may create a 4/4 green Elemental creature token.

editions.flavor:
Calm as a wisent's watch
—Elvish expression meaning "safe"

name: Eye Spy
text: Look at the top card of target player's library. You may put that card into his or her graveyard.

name: Eye to Eye
text: You and target creature's controller have a staring contest. If you win, destroy that creature.

editions.flavor: True, Gargox had blinded himself for life, but the glass eyes never lost.

name: Ezuri, Claw of Progress
text:
Whenever a creature with power 2 or less enters the battlefield under your control, you get an experience counter.
At the beginning of combat on your turn, put X +1/+1 counters on another target creature you control, where X is the number of experience counters you have.

name: Ezuri, Renegade Leader
text:
{G}: Regenerate another target Elf.
{2}{G}{G}{G}: Elf creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The infamous Ezuri commands the highest bounty the vedalken have ever placed upon an outlaw.
The infamous Ezuri commands the highest bounty the vedalken have ever placed upon an outlaw.

name: Ezuri's Archers
text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Ezuri's Archers blocks a creature with flying, Ezuri's Archers gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

name: Ezuri's Brigade
text: Metalcraft — As long as you control three or more artifacts, Ezuri's Brigade gets +4/+4 and has trample.

editions.flavor: Riding ravenous, ever-growing vorracs is almost as dangerous as fitting them with saddles.

name: Ezuri's Predation
text: For each creature your opponents control, create a 4/4 green Beast creature token. Each of those Beasts fights a different one of those creatures.

editions.flavor: "Those who do not submit will be consumed."

name: Fa'adiyah Seer
text: {T}: Draw a card and reveal it. If it isn't a land card, discard it.

editions.flavor: "My visions don't show me home. They show me where home is yet to be found."

name: Fabled Hero
text:
Double strike
Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Fabled Hero, put a +1/+1 counter on Fabled Hero.

editions.flavor: "You. Poet. Be sure to write this down."

name: Fable of Wolf and Owl
text:
Whenever you cast a green spell, you may create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, you may create a 1/1 blue Bird creature token with flying.

editions.flavor: The forest grew fangs. The sky spread its wings.
